node.title: House readies for Tuesday vote on defense bill
node.description: The National Defense Authorization Act, or the NDAA, authorizes programs and sets spending guidelines for the Department of Defense and national security programs each year.
node.content: ["Congress on Tuesday released this year's text of the annual defense bill, which includes changes to military prosecutions, more money for Ukraine and a pay raise for service members. Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the House will vote Tuesday on the bill, which will then need to be approved by the Senate.\u00a0", "The National Defense Authorization Act, or the NDAA, authorizes the programs and spending guidelines for the Department of Defense and other national security programs each year. This year's bill authorizes a topline funding of $768 billion for defense and national security with $740 billion designated for the Department of Defense.\u00a0", "As administration officials voice concern over the build-up of Russian forces near Ukraine's border, the NDAA authorizes a $50 million increase in assistance to Ukraine's security forces.\u00a0", "To deter China, the bill includes $7.1 billion for the Indo-Pacific Deterrence Initiative. The Pentagon has repeatedly called China the \"pacing challenge\" for the Department of Defense.\u00a0", "One of the most-high profile issues this year in Congress was how to handle sexual assault in the the military. The bill includes a provision that would remove the decision to prosecute crimes of sexual assault and related crimes from the chain of command, but it would not remove all felonies from the chain of command as Senator Kirsten Gillibrand of New York has pushed for.\u00a0", "\"The sexual assault reform provisions that we have in this bill are the most transformational thing that has been done in this committee in my 25 years of serving,\" Democratic Congressman Adam Smith, the Chairman of the House Armed Services Committee, told the Rules Committee on Tuesday.\u00a0 \"As we all know, for years we have dealt with the reality that sexual assault is not being adequately dealt with in the military.\"\u00a0", "The NDAA also would require the Department of Defense to track allegations of retaliation against victims of sexual assault or harassment and third-party individuals who have reported an incident.\u00a0", "Also on the domestic front, the NDAA addresses the issue of military hunger by requiring the Department of Defense to create a basic needs allowance for service members below 130% of the federal poverty guidelines to assist them with basic necessities, particularly food.", "The bill would increase military basic pay for all service members by 2.7%.\u00a0", "Several new organizational bodies are budgeted in this year's NDAA, including a joint office to track unidentified aerial phenomena, or UFOs, a Pentagon \"cross functional team\" to confront Havana Syndrome and an independent Afghanistan Commission to study the 20-year war.\u00a0", "This year's bill has taken a more delayed schedule compared to recent years due in part to disagreements over the amendment process in the Senate and the delay in bringing it to the floor.\u00a0", "To move ahead with the process, the House and Senate bills were combined through a series of negotiations led by the leadership of the House and Senate Armed Services committees.\u00a0", "CBS News reporter covering the Pentagon."]
